body.name: Savvy Sheldon Feels Good as Hell: A Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #352,621 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #3,545 in Black & African American Women's Fiction (Kindle Store) #3,785 in Multicultural & Interracial Romance (Kindle Store) #3,898 in Multicultural & Interracial Romance (Books)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Savvy Sheldon Feels Good As Hell Zora Books Her Happy Ever After The Good Ones Are Taken Feel good, laugh-out-loud, rom-coms from Taj McCoy friends-to-lovers love triangle enemies-to-lovers A sexy romance about a plus-size sweetheart who gets a full-life makeover after a brutal breakup and falls for the incredibly hot contractor renovating her home. An indie bookstore owner who finds herself in a love triangle when she meets the author she's had a crush on for years...and his best friend. When Maggie's best friend admits he's in love with her, she'll have to decide whether it's worth giving up something good for something that could be amazing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars How Savvy Got Her Groove Back
reviews.reviewText: This was definitely not a romance book as I had initially expected. Did it have romance? Yes, but that wasn’t the premise. Savvy went through a horrible breakup with Jason, whose actions throughout the book were so predictable. Typical man. Sees his ex is doing better, looking better, and feeling better, and he wants to weasel his way back in and mess it up.To cope with the breakup, Savvy makes a revenge list to show Jason what he was missing, though she quickly realized that that’s not really what she wants to do. I hated that she wanted to try to show him what he was missing.Through this process, she takes up yoga, tennis, and cooking classes, and she meets Spencer, who initially she thinks is homeless, but ends up being her contractor. I loved how she occupied her time doing things she loved, and even got a promotion she wanted, but the requirements didn’t mesh with her new life. She stood up to her mother and finally figured out what makes her happy, what makes her feel good. And cute Teddy loved him some Sheldon.Now, one thing that irked me was that Jason just kept showing up EVERYWHERE like a stalker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars curvy-licious so delicious!
reviews.reviewText: I’m so here for it. Savannah was a girl living for everyone except herself. A people pleaser who loves to cook and loves her family to boot. When Jason, her boyfriend of six years dumps her, Savvy has to find her own purpose and path. Luckily for Savvy she has an awesome girlfriend squad to give her support, encouragement and some reality checks.I love that this book wasn’t just about Savvy finding romance and love with a man, but finding love for herself and her career. She had to get right with herself and address those insecurities that made her settle and try to do what everyone else wanted instead of her own dreams.The writing in this book was very descriptive and visceral. Most of the food Savvy cooked had detailed recipes. I would have preferred the recipes to be in the back of the as opposed to actually listed in the midst of the story. But clearly this author enjoys culinary things. This audiobook was a winner.If you want a book about a curvy girl winning in the end, this is it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Savvy and her squad are a great example of a true circle of love and support. They are a diverse mix of women with varying levels of strength, insecurity, and determination. How do you process a breakup that you didn't see coming? A relationship that stopped serving you love to tear down your esteem. The revenge plot opened a flood gate of blessings. This is a good read, I didn't fall in love with Savvy but was entertained by her journey.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was a true journey. I love how savvy evolved into what we all aspire to be - someone who puts themselves first. From the insecurities, most of us feel to coming back for me break,up savvy is all of us! And while it took me a while to admit it, the great writing made me fall in love with her and Spencer! Highly recommended and while rare, I will definitely read this again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sexy, sassy and fun
reviews.reviewText: Loved this book!! The characters are incredibly well-developed and I loved all of them - well, expect maybe the ex. Read the book and you will agree. Savvy is a wonderfully complicated protagonist for whom you can’t help but cheer. She’s flawed and funny, sexy and sweet, sassy and, well, savvy. Her name suits her to a tee.McCoy’s writing is smart and colorful, filled with humor and emotion.The sex scenes are detailed enough to make you blush but don’t dominate the book. This is a great story of love, friendship and female empowerment. Oh, and really good food. Seriously. I need some recipes!In short, Savvy rocks!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I very much enjoyed the story. After Savvy (Savannah), the main character, experiences a painful breakup, she decides to make some changes in her life. At first, the changes are to prove her ex wrong and, by the end of the novel, the changes are for her.While I appreciated Savvy’s journey, and the encouragement of her ‘tribe,’ her need for constant reassurance while on the journey (especially at the beginning) was a bit much. But aside from that, I really enjoyed reading how Savvy got her groove back!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A book that most of us can relate too!
reviews.reviewText: I love this book so much! Specially relating to Savvy; I enjoyed reading a book where the main character is a women with curves. As well someone struggling to love her self and dealing with issues that we can all relate too. A great overall book! Would totally recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Where are half stars? 3.5
reviews.reviewText: First, this is NOT romance. It’s women’s fiction.This book was full of all the right ingredients but overcooked. Savvy is overworked, stressed out and in a terrible relationship. She gets out of the terrible relationship by force and decides to finally pay attention to herself. Score one for Savannah.The depiction of friendship was great and Savvy’s journey to finding the things that make her happy was nice but there was just so much focus on her tennis lessons, cooking classes and yoga. Pages of descriptions that could have been paragraphs.This was a personal irritant of mine, but I really got tired of the nicknames. I’m sure people do this but it didn’t work for me. Pages and pages of Mags, Savs, Savvy, Maggie, Joanie, choke me. Maybe a Californian trait, I can’t say.Finally, there’s barely a romantic subplot in this book. You meet her new beau immediately and they don’t really interact again until 60% of the way through. Then it’s nothing until near the end.Road trip, airport approved reading.
